meanings.definition: To assign a new date to something that was previously dated.
meanings.sent1: She redates her journal entries to keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: The librarian redates the ancient manuscripts for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: He redates his homework to make it seem like he finished it earlier.
meanings.sent4: The historian redates the artifacts to uncover their true origins.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist redates the fossils to refine the timeline of evolution.

meanings.definition: To establish a new date for something that was previously dated.
meanings.sent1: The museum curator redates the paintings to ensure their authenticity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists redates the rock layers to determine the age of the Earth.
meanings.sent3: She redates her appointment to fit in a last-minute meeting.
meanings.sent4: The detective redates the evidence to solve the cold case.
meanings.sent5: The astronomer redates the celestial events to align with new discoveries.
